channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2024100492
item.description:
Report E-2024100492

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 17, 2024, at 1621 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, TX regarding the release of LACQUER FOR EXT. CAPS. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 10 gallons of LACQUER FOR EXT. CAPS. (UN1263, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum onto the trailer floor and asphalt. The release was reportedly due to a puncture of the drum, impacting a 20’ x 10’ area in the trailer and a 20’ x 7’ area on the asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged drum was secured in an overpack and continued on with the original consignee. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal. (Full ship from address: Carretera Chichimequillas KM 5.5 Parque Industrial Puerta El Marques , QR 76240)

item.title: Report E-2024100442
item.description:
Report E-2024100442

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LAB experience a battery acid release from a 2400-pound UN2794, Battery, Wet, Filled with Acid. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 23’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor and a 30’ x 10’ area of the concrete lot below. The battery was not properly secured and fell over as a result, resulting in acid releasing from the caps and breaking the pallet. The battery was up righted and resecured for shipment on. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, impacted pallet wood, poly, and cleanup debris were then containerized into (2) 55-gallon, a 25-gallon, and a 30-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024100896
item.description:
Report X-2024100896

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: PFLUGERVILLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Mindy Smith Operations Supervisor called safety to report a spill in trailer 85389, UN3264, CORROSIVE LIQUID ACIDICINORGANIC N.O .S., 8, PG II,. Mindy stated the freight looked to have been loaded in the nose of the trailer incorrectly and the bottom of the box was damaged causing one 1 gallon pail to spill on the trailer and other freight. Mindy stated it looked to be around 64oz of the product had spilled from the nose of the trailer on to the concrete on the ground in front of the dock door 11. Mindy stated the pallet was moved from the nose of the trailer to the door to take a better look at the box and the pail that spilled. Mindy stated the spill happened in transit and looks to have had other freight damage the box with the 1 gallon pail. Mindy stated after looking at the pail it looked to have spilled 1 gallon from the 1 gallon pail on the trailer floor, other freight and the gro und (concrete) outside the dock door 11. Mindy asked if the crew could unload the rest of the trailer and wipe off the spill that was on the other freight. Safety advised Mindy to stop work on the trailer and wait for a cleaning crew to assist with the cleaning of the freight, trailer floor and the ground outside the dock door. Mindy stated no water ways or drains are affected by the spill. The box slipped between the pallet boards and the forks of a forklift appear to have slit one of the gallon pail of product in the box.

item.title: Report X-2024101191
item.description:
Report X-2024101191

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: ROUND ROCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE EMITTING AN ODOR. THE OUTER PACKAGE IS UN SPECIFICATION PACKAGING WITHOUT ANY DANGEROUS GOODS SHIPPING PAPERS, MARKS, OR LABELS APPLIED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A FIVE GALLON STEEL DRUM OF ALLIANCE CHEMICAL D-LIMONENE HIGH POWERED CITRUS SOLVENT. SDS OBTAINED FROM ALLIANCE CHEMICAL WEBSITE REVEALS PRODUCT IS REGULATED AS DANGEROUS GOODS DURING AIR TRANSPORTATION. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: UTLX 665253 was found leaking in the Slaton, TX Railyard Yard on 9/19/24. After inspection it was determined UTLX 665253 was leaking from the manway cover lid due to a misaligned gasket. The BNSF Responder replaced the misaligned manway gasket, cleaned the car and released it to final destination,

item.title: Report E-2024100459
item.description:
Report E-2024100459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: TEXAS CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5080
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, the connection between the hose adaptor and the storage tank became compromised. This allowed approximately 20 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Lone Star Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024100364
item.description:
Report E-2024100364

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 4, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN1789 was damaged during loading and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized soda ash and absorbents to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in one (1) 30-gallon drum and one (1) 15-gallon drum for disposal.
